title: Ride-Hailers Must Decide Who Pays Up to Gas Up
sub_head: As gas prices continue to rise, ride-hailers must decide whether to slap their contractors or their customers with the tab
body:
Rising gasoline prices could help or harm ride-hailers. It might depend on who they expect to pay the tab.
Ride-hailers have been assuring investors since Covid-19 first hit that a full recovery is inevitable, but a prolonged pandemic has kept their shares depressed. Now it seems macroeconomic trends could compound that pressure even if others recede. Shares of Uber Technologies and Lyft are both down more than 40% over the past year.
